intro: Dioecrescis erythroclada, commonly known as the red-veined dioecrescens, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinct dioecious nature, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are usually green or yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
